role_context.client_role: Learner who wants to objectively measure real learning
role_context.developer_role: Application developer building a learning measurement system

definition_of_learning.core_definition: Learning is the ability to retrieve, explain, and apply knowledge without external aids after time has passed.

primary_goals: Measure active recall instead of recognition
Identify weak, fragile, and stable knowledge areas
Provide explicit learning status per concept

active_recall.description: User must answer questions without seeing material or solutions first

explanation_ability.description: User can explain concepts using their own words

retention_over_time.description: Ability to answer the same or equivalent questions after delays

question_first_flow.rule: Questions must be shown before explanations or answers

concept_mapping.requirement: Each question must map to one or more concepts
concept_mapping.purpose: Track weaknesses per concept instead of global scores

definition_of_project_success.success_statement: Dashboard predictions about learning stability accurately match real performance on new or delayed questions.
definition_of_project_success.failure_indicator: User feels confident but fails retrieval after time passes
